website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, space-saving option combining a bed, bookshelves, and desk.
pros: The four wide shelves store more books than other models we tested
The 5-foot tall under-bed loft creates a comfortable work environment at the desk
cons: Ladder rungs may be hard on bare feet, and smaller kids may struggle to climb into bed because the continuous rail has no opening for the ladder
Supports up to 200 lbs., though adults may not be able to sit up in bed comfortably

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great beds. We moved our daughters from a stacked bunk to these. They are very high. There’s only about 12” of clearance for them to get over the rail. One suggestion is to get it loosely put together and then tighten everything! If you tighten as you go the bed wobbles a little.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wallace

customer_reviews.title: and their room turned out beautiful. They are in love with individualizing their own ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's are sharing a room again with our new house and I wanted to save as much space as possible...they each have one of these beds, and their room turned out beautiful. They are in love with individualizing their own spaces with in the same room. The beds themselves are sturdy, safe, and spacious...their mattresses are overstuffed with a pillow top and they are still well below the safety rail. The only thing they complain of is the thin ladder steps hurting their feet but, they also aren't used to climbing up ladders every day, and just end up putting their feet side-ways/long-ways as they walk up. It's perfectly fine, I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: misti w

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it. Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a month and a half. I absolutely hate it with a passion and so did my kid but he didn’t want to hurt my feelings. It’s wobbles like crazy, the ladder bars hurt his feet going up the ladder he would keep his scandals on the shelf to put them on each time he would go down. I just ordered a new bed frame and it cost a lot less and was super easy to assemble and feels like good quality. I don’t think I’m going to even try and resell this I think it’s going to the dump!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin.boy.mom

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble works great for making extra room in a small bedroom. The built in desk and shelves are awesome and it saves having to shop for the other items to fit under. My kid wishes the ladder rungs were covered or wider because they hurt her feet. We padded them ourselves and solved most of the issues. Also would like to be able to have options where the ladder goes instead of just the one spot. Makes some noise when shifting around but does not change how much she likes it. Want to purchase another one for the younger kid.
customer_reviews.author: Doug E.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for my boys. Not only do the screws fall out every other day from various places but also from the ladder. My sons have gotten hurt in their beds because this poor design. You can't even always see when the ladder screws are loose to know to tighten it, so coming down from the bed is like playing Russian roulette. The retainers holding the screws for the ladder are broken now because of the recurring loose screw issue, so the ladders are now literally only holding on by zip ties. Extremely pissed and disappointed. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: shelisa

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, used my nine year old to help put frame together, took about an hour and I finished up the rest in about two hours. Only one screw did not match up and it won't mess with the integrity of the bed. Might drill it out and put it in just so there isn't a hole. Minimal noise, very minimal. Kids love it, I bought battery operated strip lights to put under boards at Sam's...self adhesive and they change colors. They are perfect as there aren't any cords and it can be made into a coloured hideout! All in all, I'm very pleased. Lisa, 50 year old amputee with a just healing broken arm
customer_reviews.author: PegLegged Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Loft Bed With Ample Space
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to put together. Looks exactly as pictured. No parts were missing and we had a few extras. It says not to use power tools and you really don't need them. It comes with two small tools to use and it's honestly all you need. You only use the small wrench once. Maybe you'll want a bigger version of the tools for more ease but still not necessary. My only advice is to make sure you tighten the screws enough. Don't tighten so tight that it bends the metal in but enough to keep it sturdy. It will not wobble if everything is lined up properly and tightened just right.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The size 3 screws weren’t long enough to properly screw into the shelves so they are currently sitting loosely in place. My son and I put this together in about 3 hours. Not all the screws/holes lined up so that was a pain, but the directions were good and straightforward. I bought the pool noodle to buffer the ladder as my son says the rungs. He does wish there was an opening at the top of the ladder to make it easier to get on the bed. Don’t know if I’d buy again, but it’s together and it works so...
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: The desk area and shelving was a nice concept but just not for this metal bed
customer_reviews.text: We finally got these put together-NO INSTRUCTIONS included. Parts were missing, including a crucial piece of the desk area. My husband made it work, for a week or so. The beds were very unstable. My 6 & 8 year old (who only weigh 49 pounds for the heaviest) said the ladder hurt their feet and the bed squeaked and shifted with every turn. The desk area and shelving was a nice concept but just not for this metal bed. Would not reccomend for daily use. This may be an option for a quest room that is not used very much. Thank goodness for Amazon's return policy, we have disassembled and are returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, clear directions, extra parts if needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together, especially if you have help. Might be hard for a smaller lady, I had to rest some parts on my shoulder standing up while assembly. I would have given it 5 stars except for some small shipping damage. The desk top small corner damage and the particle board is showing. One other shelf had a dent. A few of the metal bars had very small dents. The received condition was definitely acceptable, if course anyone would like to receive a product free of damage. One of the bolt receptacles in a "t" shelf failed and won't screw down. All in all we are satisfied, my daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: jeff yapuncich

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This bed is crazy sturdy! It took a lot of time to put together but one person was able to complete it in under 2 hours. The directions can seem daunting but following them slowly it was easy enough to work through. Unlike so many other beds we had looked at this one was nice and sturdy once together and my daughter sleeps on it with zero issue and has no issues with swaying. The desk and shelf are a nice added feature so that she can study, draw, or sit under her bed reading a book.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Upper railing difficult to get over and the ladder really hurts your feet
customer_reviews.text: In the photos, the bed appears to be perfect for a college student. However, notice that the upper railing encircles the upper bed. This means you have to crawl over that railing every time you want to get in or out of the bed - not that easy. Also, the ladder kills your feet if you are in socks as it is composed of small metal bars.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Great frame for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves everything about this bed. It has given her so much more room to work with. The only things I think could be made better is if the desk and bookshelves could be installed on either side giving more flexibility, and to have a gap in the safety rail to make it easier to get on and off the bed. I actually cut one out myself with a reciprocating saw. As it comes out of the box it was a little awkward, and in my opinion slightly dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Plastic will eventually bend with weight.
customer_reviews.text: We got this loft bed for my teenager, who is quickly outgrowing everything in his life. He loves that he has a desk to do homework at away from his sisters, and shelves for his books. It has plastic cross pieces, and after a while they seem to bend based on weight. So far, it has not been anything that seems unsafe, just more of a constant pressure. We’re planning to make a board to go under the mattress to help with that and distribute weight more evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Massey

customer_reviews.title: Best loft bed with desk & shelves
customer_reviews.text: This is our third bed from my kids. The first two where bunk beds one metal one wood. The metal one I still have and it's very sturdy. This loft bed with desk and shelves is by far the best for the money. Make sure you follow instructions and use the right bolts. My daughter loves it and we added some led lights see pictures
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Schallow

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for more space in smaller kids rooms
customer_reviews.text: We used this bed for my 8 year old sons room. It is a great way to add space to small rooms and the kids think the bed is super fun. The shelves and desk offer great places to put things that would otherwise clutter up the room .Fair amount of work to assemble it by instructions were easy to follow. While the bed is sturdy I would say that is only for children under 12 and under 80-90 lbs. The bed shakes if someone my size climbs up top on it (130 lbs). Also the thin metal stairs hurt my feet but the kids don’t seem to mind.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn McKittrick

customer_reviews.title: Minor damage
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for myself, lol and I am 40 around 190 lbs, its for a computer room kinda like my inner child and man cave all in one only thing I can complain about is part of the bed was bent but not enough to cause structural damage to the whole other wise I may of asked for repelacement part which the company does say to contact them if so and they would replace for free, I just haven't had the time once I got it together, I assembled alone but would been better or easier with help, a little on the expensive side but I like it a lot and kids would probly really enjoy it
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: decent quality only issue is the ladder rungs are painful
customer_reviews.text: assembly was straight forward. Everything lined up as it should . took about an hour. Pretty sturdy. Within 10 minutes of having it setup though my son was complaining the ladder rungs hurt his feet. I thought he was just being annoying until i tried to climb them. they are like 1/2" tube rungs so your wight is not spread out like a normal flat ladder rung. It really is quite painful to climb them. Simple solution was a tube of pipe insulation from the hardware store cut to length for each rung. Would have been nice if that had been provided though. Overall pretty happy.
customer_reviews.author: cdjflyslow

customer_reviews.title: The boys sure do love their new loft beds
customer_reviews.text: The boys sure do love their new loft beds, wasn't the easiest to assemble without a helper but did figure it out a few hours of assembly. do not tighten the bolts all the way as the instructions stated until the end because some places were not fitting correctly the first bed we assembled. the second bed we assembled we kept them little loose and it was so much easier. the bed is sturdy and doesn't take up too much space as I was worried about. 2 fit in a room very well ... WE LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great loft bed for kids
customer_reviews.text: This unit is made very well. The construction is sturdy and has a modern appearance. The packaging was very well thought out and had spares for a lot of the fasteners. It did take me about two hours to complete the setup but for something this size I didn't think it was too bad. My kid loves the fact that she has a desk under the bed now and some shelves for her things. Could not be happier with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bed. Do note however that there is no opening to get in or out of. You do have to climb over the railing. Other than that, it’s amazing. The desk is great, it’s a great color, and the shelves are perfect. If your not 50 like me, climbing over the railing should be easy, I’m hoping the correct that though. You need two people to put together, but it’s easy and great directions. I definitely recommend this ALL-IN-ONE bed.
customer_reviews.author: Queenkk

customer_reviews.title: Adult proof
customer_reviews.text: Very y’all. I like the idea and my eight ur old daughter is pleased. Though she shares a room it gives her a defined space of her own, aka her “office”. I did note that the rings on the ladder ant thin and round which makes it uncomfortable for someone who is over the weight limit to climb. This effectively makes it adult proof.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany hill

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: So cheaply made. Nothing lined up right. Wobbles so bad we had to bolt it to the wall. Spend more and buy something better. I would return it if I didn’t have to box it all back up
customer_reviews.author: Crystal N Harper

customer_reviews.title: Tuff cookie
customer_reviews.text: It took all four of us my husband my two children and I to work together but all in all it was super fun and took about three hours. Only because there are so many components. But it's sturdy and my husband who weighs about 230 can get on it with no creaking or bending
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Love this bed
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had his up for a few weeks now and it’s perfect. We are limited on space and my daughter asked for a desk for her birthday. This was the perfect solution. The desk and selves are sturdy as well as the bed. I was a little nervous for such a high loft bed but so far so good! The only issue we came across was one of the shelves pre drilled holes did not align very comfortably for assembly. But all in all it wasn’t hard to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad just needs better design
customer_reviews.text: This works great for us the only issue it the steps are super uncomfortable to climb on and you have to darn near throw yourself over the top since there's no place to climb into bed. Poor design there but works great. Took about 2 hours for me to put together with no help so not to bad. Instructions were real understanding. Overall some design flaws but a good bed
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not bad per say
customer_reviews.text: I liked that shipping was earlier than expected date. My daughter has been wanting this loft bed for a while and I was able to finally get it. I did the installation myself but it does require two people for Atleast the first 20 mins of assembling. The bed does kind of shake when she’s climbing up we double checked the bolts and they were secured tight enough so maybe it’s just a minor flaw, my daughter is only 7 and weighs about 85lbs. Pretty easy step by step instructions I maybe finished it in about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Franchesca

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great bed, I'm living in an overpriced closet size room in Brooklyn in NY and this bed has helped me maximize my use of space. I'm 145lb and never feel like this bed will collapse or fall apart. I am 5' in height so it works even more but I don't think this bed would work for tall people. Recommended and saved me from having to buy a bookshelf and desk, so I consider that into the cost of the bed. It holds all my school stuff for college.
customer_reviews.author: Customer and Student

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 of them. Was happy now i am not!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to correct my review after assembling the second bed. Manufacturer defects, missing slots that are supposed to be there.Unhappy customer here. You get it 95% assembled and then you realized oh I missing a slot to put the pole in. So even if they send you a new one you have to be a symbol one whole side of the bed to put a new one on. Hope you didn't tighten anything too much because if you did good luck getting anything out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it...but...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, sturdy, and looks great! My daughter absolutely loves her new bed. The only possible negative is that the stairs of the ladder have very little depth so they are hard on the feet, making them uncomfortable to step on. Took the recommendation of others in previous reviews, and cut 1 x 3 inch pine boards to cover them.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy "Chester" Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I know this is an inexpensive loft bed, but I was hoping for better. Within 6 weeks the paint had begun to peel off the frame. There is no cut out in the rail where steps are & this makes it a bit more difficult to get in and out of. It really does need more support on the base. It is fine for smaller children & pre-teens, but not much more.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Nice and functional
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with this bed. It took me about 2.5 hours to assemble, mostly by myself with a little help from the small one. It’s nice and sturdy. Many reviewers mentioned the stairs being very harsh on the feet and it definitely is. To solve this problem we purchased bicycle handlebar tape and wrapped it around, securing with electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: nipponbabybaby

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Squeaks and is very wobbly. The stairs hurt your feet when you climb in. There is no opening at the stop so you have to climb over that part and it makes my 8 yr old nervous. Would not recommend for anyone under the age of 13 or 14. Other than that it’s cool underneath with the table and shelves. Saves on space.
customer_reviews.author: shannan callahan

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: If you're good at putting together this kind of furniture, it's easy - even by yourself (do first step upside down). Wall anchors into studs will eliminate any shaking. Definitely get some kind of wrap for the steps. Pipe insulation needs to be covered in duct tape or it will year. Other pics of Christmas lights were helpful. Search Amazon for bunk bed storage baskets and you get cheap storage up top.
customer_reviews.author: Philip S

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed, easy assembly, solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Quality materials and design. Goes together easily (took me about 4 hours, in no kind of hurry). Solid when finished, looks great. Most importantly - my son loves it. A good value at the price. Should last.
customer_reviews.author: M. Slater

customer_reviews.title: The concept of it is great once put together it is sturdy however it does ...
customer_reviews.text: Does take about 4 hours to assemble. One bar was slightly bent . The concept of it is great once put together it is sturdy however it does shake when climbing the ladder and when on the bed . It is higher than expected my son is 10 and about 4'8 an hits his head on ceiling when climbing over the bar to get in bed. The ladder does not come with padding so it does hurt the feet when going up and down. It is a great dpace saver and like i said a great concept but i dont think its worth the money . I feel as if i just spent about 300$ on basically shelves .
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My child and I put this together within a couple of hours. This including having to take off and switch a couple things because of user error. Lol She likes it so far. I even got on the bed to hang her tapestry. I was terrified and made her get from under it in case I fell to my death but it withstood my weight. Hopefully I will never have to get back on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nia Linth

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We really love this bed for our 6 year old! It gives him the floor and desk space needed as he grows up. Because it took hours to assemble, a bit more wobbly than expected (things will fall off shelves while climbing up the ladder), the ladder steps are very uncomfortable and the extra bag of replacement screws (that were not in the instructions or the original packaged parts) I have to give this 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha G.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been begging for a loft bed and this one was great for the price. It took 2 adults and 2 children an hour and half to assemble with no real issues. One hole wasn't fully drilled through but we solved that problem. My daughter loves having a desk under her bed and more space in her room. :)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Earley

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for it's price
customer_reviews.text: This bed is wonderful and very useful. My 10 year old daughter loves it. It was heavy when delivered. Two people are needed to handle this bed. It was not difficult putting the bed together. The instructions were written step by step in a well made handbook. The only tool needed was an alley key which is provided. The knly downfall is the stairs. They are painful and I wish the steps would be wider. I will try some of the hacks posted with boiler raps or pool noodles. Other than that issue I love this bed for my daughter. It's durable and not shakey at all.
customer_reviews.author: YariRod

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived crushed. One of the rails doesn't have the proper holes drilled in it. Now I have to wait for the company to send a replacement part. No ETA.
customer_reviews.author: Pope John Paul II

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid, I didn’t expect it to be as good as it actually turned out to be. This is a lot sturdier than other metal bunkbeds that I have had in the past. You definitely want to have a drill to assemble this, but it can be done with a wrench it will just be a lot slower.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together, didnt take long at all! The box is extremely heavy and long so I would encourage those with apartments to have it ordered at your door step. It was a little squeaky once assembled...not sure why...we wl use a poor drill to see if that will reduce
customer_reviews.author: mommy10

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice looking bed once all put together. It took me and a friend about 3 hours to put together once we laid everything out. All the pieces were labeled so it was helpful !! The bed does have a weight limit of 200lbs. And it is a little wobbly when climbing up and down the stairs (which should be designed differently, without slippers on it does put a lot if pressure on your feet) and it's noisey when you move around. But for the most part it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Blackard

customer_reviews.title: Very squeaky and painful to climb!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying my husband and I are very handy people. We build this type of furniture all the time. This bed is extremely noisy and the ladder is incredibly painful on my son’s feet. We had to wrap the treads with pool noodles. My other son has a different brand bunk bed and is FAR superior! Literally, makes no noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: fairly simple to put together, as long as you read the directions properly. my wife and i put this together then took it apart about 3 times because we didn't read the directions. that being said, having taken it apart 3 times it is still pretty sturdy, all the screws went in fine every time and it held me in it to put the sheets on the mattress, so it can support 200 lbs. looks nice. only missing a star because the ladder is really hard on the feet. we ended up buying a foam pool noodle and cutting it up and putting it around the steps so it's easier to bear.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Shrumpert

customer_reviews.title: OK Loftbed
customer_reviews.text: This loft bed is just ok. My daughter has been using it for about 4 months now. It was a little challenging to put together. I had to take it apart and start over 3-4 times. That was super frustrating. Even though it seems sturdy, it does wobble a bit. As stated in other reviews, the ladder really DOES hurt! Overall, you get what you pay for. I regret not putting this money toward a more quality bed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: I created the Perfect Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I went all out for my son for his birthday this year since we couldn't invite people over. Wanted to ensure my babies are safe with COVID and all. I decked out his room with this new loft bed and added pieces to surprise him. We added bows to everything that was new in his room! LOL! It was great because we legit re-modeled his room and didn't let him in until his birthday. I had presents both open and wrapped all over his room, which became the perfect gift.
customer_reviews.author: norma

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a desk for my sons room and we have little space. So my hubby suggested to think vertically. After lots of searching, we settled on this loft. You could put it together by yourself, but it helps to have a partner. There was a dent where two of the poles were packaged, but it’s in a place where it’s not as noticeable. All the pieces and parts were present. It is a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Beimler

customer_reviews.title: A little bit of a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited to get this bed to upgrade to a big boy room and create more space. First a piece cake damaged. The company replaced and it came within a week and a half. After getting the bed together I noticed that no matter how tight I get the screws it squeaks and wobbles a bit. Hoping it was quiet as it is used and I can randomly tighten to ensure it stays together. As it is a lot taller than I expected. Which is fine it allowed for more room where the desk is. Not sure if we will be able to keep things on the shelves with the amount of wobbling.
customer_reviews.author: Nuala O'Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bed with a ton of storage
customer_reviews.text: This bed is my 11 year olds favorite thing in her room! She keeps going on about all the ways she wants to decorate and make it her own. She loves everything about this bed. The desk is her favorite part. She is actually doing her homework now which is awesome! Also having storage for her book collection is my favorite thing!
customer_reviews.author: S Finnell

customer_reviews.title: An amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product!! Fairly easy to put together, and soooo efficient! It's perfect for a child who needs more floor space in a small room. Perfect amount of space on shelves for computers, books and small bins of toys. It's sturdy and very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Madelynn aldama

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great bed for the kids. It can save tons of space if you need that but it also looks really good and is quality. The parts it comes with prevents unwanted rattle noises from the metal. The ladder is very discomforting on the feet though.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Make sure u have high ceilings
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea of this product when I bought it for my 9 year old and now that shes 11 she doesnt like that she is so close to the ceiling. I say its a great buy but make sure u have high ceilings!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small space.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bed for a small room. My 10 year old loves it. The shelves and desk add a lot of space. It’s about 58” from the floor to the bottom of the rail, so my daughter can stand under it. Her vanity even fits underneath it with plenty of space to spare. All-in-all a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bunk bed for myself as a college student, it compacts all the thing I need in a small space. My mom basically told me I had a small apartment in my room in the apartment we were living in, that was just missing a kitchen (which is to be solved soon with a mini fridge). Easy to get in out of even with the rail, though highly suggest on some pool noodle coverings of somekind cuz the metal bars are kinda killer on the feet. Great way to customize the bed though with a cool color of pool noodles and fun patterned duck tape.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of hours to assemble, but fairly easy to put together. We had a couple of issues with the wood pieces lining up correctly, but after some pushing and pulling, it all worked out. My 11 year old loves it other than the ladder..,the bars hurt your feet, but I stole someone else’s idea and cut up a pool noodle and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Savy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kiddo!
customer_reviews.text: Early birthday present for our soon to be 9 year old and he loves it. Read the directions careful when putting together because it's very easy to get the posts or the sides mixed up and then other pieces won't fit together and you'll have to take it apart. Make sure to have another adult or teenager around to help!
customer_reviews.author: lilolash

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and unstable. This product does not feel safe. It is put together properly and all screws are tight, but it is really wobbly. I jus bought this item feb 2020 and I already I had to purchase another bed for my daughter due to safety concerns. Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. I wish there was an opening at the top so that my 8 yr old wouldn't have to climb over the top to get into bed that causes her to be close to the ceiling. Also bars on the ladder hurt her little feet. I cut a pool noodle to wrap around & problem solved. The box was huge & came super fast
customer_reviews.author: Marketa

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st big boy bed for my son!
customer_reviews.text: The only cons that I have for the bed is the ladder. The rings are a little too small and thin and cause discomfort while climbing it. Also, there should be an opening by the ladder instead of having to climb over the frame. Other than that a solid purchase!
customer_reviews.author: William Sean Hainsworth

customer_reviews.title: This bed changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: This bed changed my life! My 11 year old son has autism and finally got his own room after big sister moved out. I got this bed to entice him to actually *want* to have his own private space to use his computer/sleep in our small apartment (as opposed to sleeping on the couch and using a desk in the TV room -not allowing anyone to make sound/watch TV etc) and he loves it! I put it together myself, wasn't too hard, everything nicely labeled. It's a good sturdy bed, and can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to build and looks nice when complete.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy and straight forward. Parts are easy to differentiate. Hardware was well made and easy to use. As expected the included tools will **DO** the job but it's alot easier if you get a small drill or ratchet for all the Hex bolts. 4mm hex and a 3/8's socket for the 4 lock nuts. All in all, took approx. 2 hours to put together, and that was a pretty relaxed pace. ****Protip: Don't tighten the bolts down as you go. Barely snug them up and finish them after everything else is done. It makes everything fit into place better, as the wiggle room takes the fight out of lining up bolt holes.
customer_reviews.author: Gimvarg

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new bed. The only thing I have to complain about is that the bed came dented. Its on the inside of the bed part, so you can't see it, but I know it's there. It was pretty easy to put together, so long as you pay attention to the letters and follow the directions.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waterfield

customer_reviews.title: Great except the ladder
customer_reviews.text: I put this together by myself. Im so glad I bought this. The only issue is the ladder. The ladder hurts your feet and when my 5 year old goes to climb into the bed he complained about it hurting his private area due to having to climb over the railing and the top step being kinda far away. So For now I secured a metal ladder to bed until I buy a different type of ladder that can hang on the side. If your kid is tall enough you can just cut pool noodles and place them over the steps.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Order a white bed, cream arrived. Product description said wood. No wood, all metal. Pieces are dented and missing paint. . Very disappointing. Would not recommend. Would love to return, but was a Christmas present for my 6 year old and cried, because I did not want to assemble. Now I have a dented bed, with black marks that's cream and white trim in her room. Thanks for providing a disappointing product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Mckenzie

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids, not adults or teens
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble. Was the perfect fit and style for my daughter's small bedroom. Only bad thing is there is no cutout in the side rail where the ladder is so the bed is difficult to climb into. Also the ladder steps are small, round, and painful for anyone of an adult weight to step on.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Good

customer_reviews.title: Good for 4th grader!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a 10 year old. The only thing that was wrong was the stickers they stuck on each end of bed. Unable to get them off without ruining the bed and having sticky stuff everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: ashlei

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles and squeaks.
customer_reviews.text: This bed was easy to assemble. However, the bed is not very sturdy and squeaks are annoying. I had to drill and secure the bed frame with lag screws into studs in the wall to stop the wobbling and squeaks.
customer_reviews.author: JCJns

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old loves it. The only complaint is the stairs are terrible on the feet. It definitely needs some kind of padding. Plan to get a noodle and use it to cover the stairs. Other than that it's a really good sturdy bed. We were not disappointed at all.
customer_reviews.author: soblessed

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made Kids Bed
customer_reviews.text: Amazing kids bed! My grandson is in heaven with this bed, and he loves that he has a desk right under it as well, making it feel like a fort of sorts. Very happy with the sturdiness of this bed as well, and fits in a very small room too. This bed was a huge hit!
customer_reviews.author: Mallori Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her new bed. Because of online school now we needed more space to add a desk. This fit the bill. She is 8, and absolutely loves her new bed and desk. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Owens

customer_reviews.title: Im a 10 year old girl and I LOVED IT!
customer_reviews.text: Im a 10 year old girl and I LOVED IT!!! Because its medal,,, I can sick on magnets on too!!! 😄 the ladder is round so it hurts at first but I got used to it. Also its a little wobbly.😑 AND... 2 kids or a adult can go up because of the weight. And I guess I have to duck when I go in and out cause it almost touches my head. But its very useful and I LOVE it
customer_reviews.author: Jong

customer_reviews.title: It's not that sturdy it will wobble a little
customer_reviews.text: We love the design and simplicity of this bed but it does have alot of movement when kids on the bed and stuff sometimes falls over on the shelves from the wobble or shaking if it bracing it to the wall where studs are helps
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Cute with flaws
customer_reviews.text: Assembly directions are not clear. Assembled it wrong several time and had to take apart to complete it. Took about 6 hours. Finished product is attractive and versatile but nit steady. I don’t think it would be safe for a child over 100 pounds. Difficult to make the bed with only the one ladder.
customer_reviews.author: PrinSharon

customer_reviews.title: Nice beds but heavy
customer_reviews.text: We ended up getting two of these beds since our girls share a room and wanted some personal space of their own. The boxes they came in were pretty heavy.. it took two grown men to hoist them up the stairs. Assembly was pretty intense too.. I’m a shade tree mechanic but it still took a couple hours apiece to put them together. Overall though, they’re very sturdy and my kids love them. They’re very nice beds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise we are very happy with the
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two bed for my grandsons. They went together very well. It took about 90 minutes to do the first bed but the second one went together a lot easier. One of the beds was missing one of the slats for the bed and has to be ordered. Otherwise we are very happy with the bed
customer_reviews.author: larry zynda

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8yo daughter, to give her more space in her room. She loves it. Two complaints: 1) The ladder rungs hurt her feet, and the smooth metal/paint makes them a little slippery. 2) There is no ‘cut out’ at the top where the kids climb into bed. They literally have to climb up and over the railing, which doesn’t seem very safe.
customer_reviews.author: MonopoliQueen

customer_reviews.title: This bed is just ok. it is very thin ...
customer_reviews.text: This bed is just ok. it is very thin metal. I was expecting it to be very thick and durable metal as their prior beds were but it was also a huge price difference by couple 1000 bucks. So I got what I paid for. I tighten the bolts as much as it would allow and the bed still squeaks every time my son moves on it. It is a very high bed. Make sure it has a room with high ceilings as my son's head touches the ceiling when he sits upon it.
customer_reviews.author: chrystal noble

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely easy to assemble. It feels a bit shaky but I believe it's sturdy enough. It has a good setup for functionality with the bed, desk and shelving. I would say the only downside would be no entry for the ladder area. You have to climb over the railing because there is no opening to get through and the ladder itself is uncomfortable climbing it. Put some noodles on it for padding and I'm sure it'll be fine. Overall good for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her new bed. Bookshelf was perfect for her books so we were able to get rid of her standalone bookshelf. The holes for the shelves dont line up perfectly when you just set it in. We had to slide them in from the side and then one person pushed the shelf with his thumb while holding the bed frame so that they would line up. Once the screws were in, it fits perfectly. Definitely a 2-man job. Took about 2 hours to assemble but it looks great. Very sturdy and no squeaking for it to be metal which is a plus. Tons of free space on the floor now that the bed goes up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome loft bed!
customer_reviews.text: May daughter loves her new loft bed. It’s perfect! She does her art and school work at the desk and the bookshelves are great they hold a plethora of books and notebooks. The bed is close to the ceiling and gives a feeling of being in a fort. She was scared to sleep in her regular bed but sleeps peacefully in this bed every night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love them, the kids love them... its a win win! The instructions were easy to follow. A few poles were dented up out of the box, but I’m pretty sure that’s due to shipping. Freed up a lot of space for the 2 kids stuck sharing a room
customer_reviews.author: Diana Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Bed
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase of the Loft Bed/Desk. I purchased this bed for my granddaughter, and I will admit I was a little worried that it would not be sturdy enough. However, I was very surprised to find that the bed was well constructed and did not wobble at all! It was exactly what she wanted and a space saver for her room. I would highly recommend the purchase of this bed to others.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Shop Around
customer_reviews.text: Bed is fine but the shelves came ruined and when we reordered them, they were broken too. My son likes the bed overall but I wish we had found him something else.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: Took MUCH longer to assemble than the instructions said... but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a hit with my daughter. The instructions say it might take 90 minutes to assemble. It took more like 3 hours - mostly because there are so many parts and no one wants to have to do something more than once. Take your time and get it right. Great bed. Lots of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Tia D

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction and not very stable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 y/o for his birthday. We have not even had it three weeks and the ladder has broken of the bed making it completely unusable. Looking where the ladder was attached the metal is rusted. Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Berry

customer_reviews.title: Child Pleaser!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his bed. The stairs though are a tad bit painful as they such small metal tubes so we had to cover them with pool noodles. I'm glad I got this - value for the money was extremely good as it already has a desk and shelves!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for loft bed with desk
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this bed is amazing and everything we had wanted for our daughter’s room. The only things I would change is to have more choice in where to attach the ladder, and to make the rungs bigger, as they tend to hurt feet that aren’t in shoes while climbing up. Otherwise, it’s an amazing bed and we’re extremely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaRian

customer_reviews.title: Great set.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter who is 15 years old and within the weight range of 125 - 160 and it is very stable and able to keep her comfortable , it is perfect if you need more space in the bedroom perfect way to add some.
customer_reviews.author: gypsee girl

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver bed for kids
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my daughter wanted, lots of space underneath I was able to put it together myself and I don’t do a lot of diy projects
customer_reviews.author: Janelle S Riedesel

customer_reviews.title: Great bed!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for younger kids! Took a little time to assemble with help. The ladder rings should be flat instead of rounded!
customer_reviews.author: usmcman

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it!
customer_reviews.text: It's too tall my daughter will never be able to sleep in it there's no opening to get in and out cant use ladder without shoes and it unsturdy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best for distance learning!!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old daughter loves it!! The only complaint I have is that the steps are uncomfortable to go up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Onehappytiredmom

customer_reviews.title: Screw holes misaligned a bit, otherwise pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I like this design for a bed. It seems pretty sturdy and I think my kids will get some good use out of it, especially with all the built-in shelving. But assembly was a bit of a hassle. Two of the screw holes were misaligned. I had to bust out my Dremel and widen both holes in order to get the screws to go in. Once I did that, it went together fine.
customer_reviews.author: gerald fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Loft Bed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, nice space saver and looks cool! One improvement suggestion would be padding on the ladder rungs (we added our own).
customer_reviews.author: LisaSoNice

customer_reviews.title: Good bed but wouldn’t pay full price
customer_reviews.text: Like the bed overall. Package came damaged and one of the bars has a small dent in it but it has not affected its use and it just so happened to be the part that faces the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen G.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great kinda wobbly
customer_reviews.text: A pain to put together by yourself. Definetly need to have 2 people. Looks great put together but is quite wobbly even with a small child on it.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty cheap/flimsy but for the price it is what it is. Wouldn’t recommend for an older child (over like 12) it’s not strong enough
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! My sons extremely small room went from having a bed and no floor space to OMG he has a floor and a place to put his toys!! My 6 year old son is also pumped to have a desk to do his homework and color 👌. My husband said it was very easy to set up as well! It’s very high so we will have to remove fan and just do a light but soooo worth it because he actually has a room he can use and play in and not just sleep.!
customer_reviews.author: Alfred W. Swedberg, DC

product_meta.title: DHP Studio Loft Bunk Bed Over Desk and Bookcase with Metal Frame, Gray, Twin
product_meta.description: Color:SilverWith space becoming such an essential commodity, it pays to think vertical! the DHP studio loft bed allows you to maximize your living space by taking advantage of vertical space! the DHP studio loft bed is cleverly designed to accommodate a twin mattress and a built-in desk with four shelves to store your books, laptop, picture frames, etc. This space saving solution with pleasing aesthetics is constructed of strong metal frame in a silver finish, multiple metal slats and safety rails. The DHP studio loft bed makes it possible to afford an attractive workstation with storage without compromising on design. A winning combination!.
